title: Vitamin B12
summary: Vitamin B12, also known as cobalamin, is a water-soluble vitamin involved in metabolism.[2][3] It is one of eight B vitamins. It is a cofactor in DNA synthesis, in both fatty acid and amino acid metabolism.[4] It is important in the normal functioning of the nervous system via its role in the synthesis of myelin,[3][5] and in the maturation of red blood cells in the bone marrow.[6]
